fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.forplugins

Class AbstractInboundPortForPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.forplugins.AbstractInboundPortForPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, InboundPortI, PortI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicConnectionRequestInboundPort, PushControlInboundPort

    public abstract class AbstractInboundPortForPlugin
extends AbstractInboundPort
    The class AbstractInboundPortForPlugin extends the standard inbound port for the case where the services to be called is implemented by a plug-in.

    Description

    The inbound port must directly call a plug-in with a specific URI, so the plug-in URI is passed at the creation of the port and used at each call.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2017-12-22

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        create and initialise inbound ports, with a given URI and a given plug-in URI.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null and owner != null and implementedInterface != null
 pre    pluginURI != null
 pre    OfferedI.class.isAssignableFrom(implementedInterface)
 pre    implementedInterface.isAssignableFrom(this.getClass())
 pre    this.getOwner().isInstalled(pluginURI)
 post   this.getPortURI().equals(uri)
 post   this.getOwner().equals(owner)
 post   this.getImplementedInterface().equals(implementedInterface)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the port.
        implementedInterface - interface implemented by this port.
        pluginURI - URI of the plug-in to be called.
        owner - component that owns this port.
